ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I have learned so much in ASL. I feel as though I would be able to hold my end in a conversation in ASL. I really enjoyed this class and I am looking forward to learning more next semester.
I gained skills in ASL such as greetings, personality, classifiers, and poetry.
I learned a lot about American Sign Language
I learned basic conversation skills in ASL as well as foundations in understanding various aspects of Deaf culture

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strength: My professor was really engaging and energetic. I think this is needed for a language classroom. He was able to teach us in a way that was very efficient and fun. 

Weakness: Sometimes I felt like the finger spelling was too fast too quickly. I am still trying to get a hang of it so when our professor signs quickly, it is hard to follow.

Strengths: Zen is an engaging professor and always willing to help the students! He's also hilarious and down to earth, making the class feel like a conversation rather than an actual class. Overall, I loved taking the course with him! 

Weaknesses: Students with social anxiety may suffer because he tends to put students in front of the class to sign. He is VERY kind and does not humiliate his students, but sometimes, the student might not be comfortable signing in front of the whole class.

This course is very hands on, and I appreciated the balance between focus in class and time outside of class to participate in Deaf community activities. However, the asynchronous hours felt a little unstructured

There was not a lot of feedback given for most assignments. I felt a little left adrift and our instructor didnt check in with us very often about how things were going/what we needed to focus on individually.

Strengths included being able to practice every day and fostering an inclusive, affirming environment.

I think the course could be improved organizationally. The Canvas assignments were pretty disorganized, and I missed a couple assignments because they were mislabeled as having no due date or buried beneath several other unrelated assignments.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely. I think everyone should learn ASL. Not only did I learn about the language, but I also learned so much about the ASL/deaf community and culture that I think everyone should experience and learn about.
I would highly recommend this course to another student if they want to immerse themselves in the language and Deaf culture!
I would recommend this course to other students because it is very engaging, Informative, and fun. I genuinely enjoyed class time and gaining new perspectives on Deaf culture and the Deaf community
